info.name: DCIM FastAPI Backend
info.description:
Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) API used by the Angular UI.

## Authentication & RBAC
- Obtain JWT access + opaque refresh tokens via `/api/dcim/login` and store them as Postman collection variables.
- Most endpoints require Bearer auth with the **access token**; mutations require editor/admin, and deletes are admin-only.
- `/refresh` validates the refresh token and issues a **new JWT access token** while reusing the same refresh token until it expires.
- `/logout` invalidates all refresh tokens for the current user; once the refresh token expires or is invalidated, the user must log in again.

### Location-based RBAC
- Non-admin users are restricted to specific locations configured in `dcim.dcim_user_location_access (user_id, location_id)`.
- All listing, export, search, summary, and details endpoints automatically scope results to the user's allowed locations.
- Admin users are unrestricted and see all locations; other roles must have at least one location row or they will receive `403` errors.

## API Highlights
- Listings, details, CRUD, delete, and audit endpoints all share the `entity` selector: `locations`, `buildings`, `wings`, `floors`, `datacenters`, `racks`, `devices`, `device_types`, `asset_owner`, `makes`, `models`, `applications`.
- **Global Search:** `/api/dcim/search` searches across ALL fields in all entity types. Searches string fields (names, descriptions, IPs, serial numbers, etc.), numeric fields (IDs, heights, positions, etc.), and related entity names. Returns results grouped by entity type. Results are also restricted to the user's allowed locations.
- All filters are applied at the database level for optimal performance. Use query parameters to filter by any column (e.g., `location_name`, `building_status`, `device_status`, `rack_height`, etc.).
- `/api/dcim/list/export` streams CSV using the same filters as `/list` so the UI can offer download buttons. Exports are also location-scoped for non-admin users.
- `/health` performs a live database ping plus runtime metadata check; point uptime monitors or frontend readiness guards here.
- Bulk uploads enqueue background jobs and email a detailed per-row report to the logged-in user.
- **Device Images:** Devices support image uploads via `multipart/form-data`. Images are stored locally and paths are returned in device details. Use "Create Device with Image" and "Update Device Image" requests for image operations.

## Foreign Key Strategy
All relationships are referenced by `*_name` fields (case-insensitive lookups) to keep payloads human readable.

item.name: Global Search

query.description: Search query string (searches across ALL fields in all entities)

request.description:
Global search across ALL fields in all DCIM entities.

**Searches in:**
- **locations**: ID, name, description
- **buildings**: ID, name, status, description, location_id, location name/description
- **racks**: ID, name, status, description, height, width, space_used, space_available, location/building names
- **devices**: ID, name, serial_no, IP, status, PO number, asset_user, position, space_required, description, and related entity names (location, building, rack, make, device_type, application, asset_owner)
- **device_types**: ID, name, description, make_id, make name/description
- **makes**: ID, name, description
- **models**: ID, name, description, height, make_id, device_type_id, make/device_type names
- **datacenters**: ID, name, description, location_id, building_id, location/building names
- **asset_owners**: ID, name, description, location_id, location name/description
- **applications**: ID, name, description, asset_owner_id, asset_owner name/description

**Examples:**
- `q=server` - finds devices, device types, models, etc. containing "server"
- `q=192.168.1.1` - finds devices with that IP address
- `q=42` - finds entities with ID 42, height 42, position 42, etc.
- `q=active` - finds all entities with "active" status
- `q=Dell` - finds makes named "Dell" and related devices/models

Returns results grouped by entity type. All searches are case-insensitive. Numeric searches also match exact ID/number values. Requires viewer or higher access.

item.description: Global search endpoint that searches across ALL fields in all DCIM entity types. Returns results grouped by entity type with a maximum number of results per type. Requires viewer or higher access.

request.description:
Create a device with uploaded images.

**Content-Type:** `multipart/form-data`

**Form fields:**
- `data`: JSON string containing all device fields (same as Create Device without image)
- `front_image`: Front device image file (jpg, jpeg, png, gif, webp, max 10MB)
- `rear_image`: Rear device image file (optional)

**Required fields in data JSON:** Same as "Create Device" endpoint.

The images will be saved to the configured storage path and the `front_image_path` / `rear_image_path` will be stored in the database and returned in the response and device details.

item.description:
Unified CSV bulk upload endpoint supporting multiple entity types via the `entity_type` query parameter.

**Supported entity types:**
- `devices` - Single device entities
- `racks` - Single rack entities
- `entity_wfd` - Wings, Floors, Datacenters (hierarchical)
- `entity_asset_details` - Asset Owners, Applications Mapped
- `entity_devicetypes` - Makes, Device Types, Models

All requests return `job_id` + `report_recipient` immediately (HTTP 202) and continue processing in the background before emailing a detailed report.
